intro: Rapanea oligophylla, commonly known as the small-leaved evergreen, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Lauraceae family and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree or shrub, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a smooth surface, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a small, woody drupe that contains a single seed.
